dialogues: Ah, she owns the place, but that’s about all I know.
Jose: She’s also the mother of the janitor here.
Jose: They don’t get along great from what I’ve heard.
Jose: I think she’s just been putting too much pressure on the boy after they both lost his father.
Jose: But I prefer not to get involved. They’re family after all.
Jose: And I have full faith that they’ll work it out.
Jose: I mean, that’s how it was with my family after all, pal. Ha-ha.
Ebenezer: Your family, hmm? Could you tell me more about that?
Jose: Another time, maybe, ha-ha. The story’s much too long.
